com.safenetinc.luna.virtualhosts
Class ServerXmlHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.safenetinc.luna.virtualhosts.ServerXmlHandler
public class ServerXmlHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Class to handle changes to Tomcat's server.xml configuration file.

Author:
Paul Hampton

Method Detail

removeServerXmlReadOnlyAttribute

public static void removeServerXmlReadOnlyAttribute()
                                             throws ServerXmlException
Removes the read only attribute from server.xml. This attribute is set by default with a fresh Luna SP jail installation. Java doesn't provide a way of changing the read only attribute (only setting it) so this method renames the file before copying it back to its original name. Removing the read only attribute is a side effect of this process.

Throws:
ServerXmlException - If modifying the file was not possible.

addVirtualHost

public static void addVirtualHost(java.lang.String name,
                                  int port)
                           throws ServerXmlException
Adds a virtual host entry to server.xml. This takes the form of a element. A non standard attribute named correspondingConnectorPort is added by this method, this contains the port number of the associated connector, due to mandating SSL applications such as ViewPIN effectively have a 1-1 mapping between a connector and a virtual host. The correspondingConnectorPort attribute provides a way of tracking this.

Parameters:
name - The name of the virtual host
port - The port that users will access this virtual host from
Throws:
ServerXmlException

deleteVirtualHost

public static void deleteVirtualHost(java.lang.String name)
                              throws ServerXmlException
Deletes a virtual host configuration by removing the element

Parameters:
name - The name of the virtual host
Throws:
ServerXmlException - Thrown if changing the server.xml fails for any reason

getPortForVirtualHost

public static int getPortForVirtualHost(java.lang.String name)
                                 throws ServerXmlException
Uses the correspondingConnectorPort attribute to determine which port a virtual host is being accessed on. Used for mapping hosts to connectors.

Parameters:
name - The name of the virtual host
Returns:
int representing the TCP port of the associated connector
Throws:
ServerXmlException - Thrown if reading or parsing the server.xml was not possible

getVirtualHostsList

public static java.util.Vector getVirtualHostsList()
                                            throws ServerXmlException
Creates a Vector of String objects representing the names of the virtual hosts configured for this Tomcat install.

Returns:
a Vector of String objects
Throws:
ServerXmlException - Thrown if reading and parsing the server.xml file was not possible

virtualHostExists

public static boolean virtualHostExists(java.lang.String hostname)
                                 throws ServerXmlException
Determines whether a given name matches (case insensitive) that of a configured virtual host.

Parameters:
hostname - The name of the virtual host to look for.
Returns:
boolean denoting whether a host with the given name is configured.
Throws:
ServerXmlException - Thrown if reading and parsing the server.xml file failed

addConnector

public static void addConnector(int port,
                                java.lang.String keyAlias)
                         throws ServerXmlException
Deprecated. Use the Luna SP command webs server port addSecure instead

Adds a connector to the server.xml

Parameters:
port - The TCP port to use for the connector
keyAlias - The SSL certficate Subject Key Identifier for the SSL certificate to be used with this connector
Throws:
ServerXmlException - Thrown if writing to the server.xml file was not possible for some reason

changeCertificateForConnector

public static void changeCertificateForConnector(int port,
                                                 java.lang.String certificateAlias)
                                          throws ServerXmlException
Modifies a connector to specify a different SSL certificate. Certificates are located by their associated Subject Key Identifiers

Parameters:
port - The TCP port for the connector to be edited
certificateAlias - The Subject Key Identifier for the SSL certificate the connector will use
Throws:
ServerXmlException - Thrown if reading, parsing or writing to the server.xml failed for some reason

deleteConnector

public static void deleteConnector(int port)
                            throws ServerXmlException
Deletes all connectors on a given port. Valid server.xml files will have one connector per port, consequently this method only deletes the first matching connector it finds

Parameters:
port - The port of the connector to remove
Throws:
ServerXmlException - Thrown if reading, parsing or writing the server.xml file fails.

checkForConnectorOnPort

public static boolean checkForConnectorOnPort(int port)
                                       throws ServerXmlException
Looks for a connector on a given TCP port.

Parameters:
port - The TCP port to look for a connector on
Returns:
boolean denoting whether a connector exists for the specified port.
Throws:
ServerXmlException - Thrown if reading or parsing the server.xml file failed

setSecureCiphersForConnectors

public static void setSecureCiphersForConnectors()
                                          throws ServerXmlException
Method to change the cipher suites for all connectors within a server.xml Required in order to use JDK1.5 with Tomcat 5.5.16 and Firefox but also required in order to prevent tomcat supporting insecure ciphers

Throws:
ServerXmlException - Thrown if reading, parsing or writing the server.xml file

setConnectionParameters

public static void setConnectionParameters(java.lang.String serverName)
                                    throws ServerXmlException
Method to tune the parameters for all connectors. Sets values that the LunaSP is able to cope with when under heavy load.

Parameters:
serverName - The server name to return to connecting clients. Replaces the default apache/tomcat value
Throws:
ServerXmlException - Thrown if saving the configuration changes was not possible
